metadata.title: CVE-2016-9573 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in OpenJPEG 2.1.2, in thej2k_to_image tool. Converting a specially crafted JPEG2000 file to anotherformat could cause the application to crash or, potentially, disclose somedata from the heap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
